00037 /*
00038  * constants.h

00043 #ifndef CONSTANTS_H_
00044 #define CONSTANTS_H_
00045 #include "types.h"
00046 
00047 //The Current Version of Code. Dump files and other
00048 //configs will have to be consistent with this version
00049 //for their use
00050 static const double CURRENT_VERSION = 1.1;
00051 
00052 //Num of tokens in flight which is specified for TBB
00053 static const size_t NUM_SAMPLERS = 50000;
00054 
00055 //Used to do upfront memory reservation for the updates vector
00056 //which is the vehicle used to transport msgs from the sampler
00057 //to the updater
00058 static const size_t EXP_NUM_WORDS_PER_DOC = 1000;
00059 
00060 static const size_t BITS_PER_BYTE = 8;
00061 
00062 //Max size permitted for the protobuffer msg
00063 //msgs are written as binary files in (size, msg)* format
00064 static const size_int MAX_MSG_SIZE = 10000000;
00065 
00066 //Interval for logging a status msg to INFO
00067 static const int PRT_CNT_INTERVAL = 50000;
00068 
00069 //Default value of alphabar
00070 static const double ALPHA_SUM = 50.;
00071 
00072 //Default value for beta
00073 static const double BETA = 0.01;
00074 
00075 //Default value for gamma
00076 static const double GAMMA = 0.01;
00077 
00078 //Default value for delta
00079 static const double DELTA = 0.01;
00080 
00081 //when alpha optimization is turned on, alphas
00082 //are always >= MIN_ALPHA
00083 static const double MIN_ALPHA = 0.01;
00084 
00085 static const word_t NUM_WORDS_PER_TOP = 20;
00086 
00087 static const word_t NUM_TOPICS_PER_DOC = 10;
00088 
00089 static const word_t MAX_MSGS = 10;
00090 
00091 //The number of Random Number Generators(RNGs)
00092 //used to simulate one RNG per thread behaviour
00093 //as TBB does not allow thread local state. We
00094 //create NUM_RNGS RNGs and access one of them
00095 //pseudo-randomly
00096 static const uint16_t NUM_RNGS = 32;
00097 
00098 //Used as the mask instead of mod operator
00099 static const uint16_t RNG_MASK = (1 << 5) - 1;
00100 
00101 //Max allowed memory size. If you try allocating
00102 //more than this we will abort
00103 static const uint64_t MAX_MEMORY_USAGE = ((uint64_t) 1) << 34;
00104 
00105 //If you try allocating more than this much memory,
00106 //you will be warned that there might be something
00107 //going wrong. If you are using a very large data set
00108 //this is expected
00109 static const uint32_t WARN_MEMORY_SIZE = 1 << 31;
00110 
00111 //Max number of attempts before we give up on
00112 //acquiring a lock. This is relevant for the
00113 //multi-machine code
00114 static const uint16_t LOCK_MAX_TRIES = 60;
00115 
00116 //This is the maximum number of attempts before
00117 //we give up on waiting for all clients to init.
00118 //This is relevant for the multi-machine code
00119 static const uint16_t INIT_COM_MAX_TRIES = 60;
00120 
00121 //Expiry time in secs for the lock set on memcached
00122 //This is relevant for the multi-machine code
00123 static const time_t LOCK_EXPIRY_TIME = 10; //in secs
00124 
00125 //This is a multiplier used with the LOCK_EXPIRY_TIME
00126 //when we try to reacquire a lock
00127 //This is relevant for the multi-machine code
00128 static const uint16_t REACQUIRE_BUFFER = 2;
00129
